div.l: Right in cherles termes wole I now speke
I pray to god his nekke mote to breke
He cann wel in myn eie now se a stalke
But in his owne he can nat se balke
At trumpynton nat fer fro Cambrugge
Ther goth a broke and oủer that a brigge
Vpon the whiche broke ther stant a Mille
And this is verrey soth that I you telle
A Miller ther was dwellyng many day
As any pocok he was proude and gay
Pypyn he couthe and fisshe and nettis bete
And turne Cuppis and well wrestill and schete
Ay by his belte he bare longe panade
And of a swerde ful trenchaunt was the blade
A ioly popper bare he in his pouche
The nas man for perill that durst hym touche
A shefilde twitle bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face and kamois was his nose
As pillid as and ape was his skulle
He was market betere at the full
Ther durst no wight hand upon hym legge
That he ne swore a none he schulde a begge
A thef he was for sothe of corne and mele
And that a shigh and vsaunt for to stele
His name was hote deynose Symekyn
A wif he had comen of noble kynne
The persoun of the toune hir fadir was
With hir he yaf full many panne of bras
For that Symkyn scholde in his blode a lie
Sche was I fostred in a nonnerie
For Symkyn wolde no wif as he seide
But sche wer wel I norisshid and a maide
To saue his state of yemanrie
And he was proude and perte as any pie
A ful faire sight was hit vpon hem thoo
On halidaies to fore hir wolde he goo
With his typett bounden a boute his de de hede
And sche cam aftir in gite of rede
And Symkyn had hosyn of the same
